newsitem.title: USA: Wired Ventures IPO withdrawn - underwriter.
newsitem.headline: Wired Ventures IPO withdrawn - underwriter.

text.p: The initial public offering of Wired Ventures Inc has been withdrawn due to market conditions, lead underwriter for the deal, Goldman Sachs, said Friday.

The company, which publishes "WIRED" magazine, was originally expected to make its market debut Friday, but had been put on hold Thurday evening with a further announcement pending. The offering was reduced to three million from 4.75 million common shares, while the price range also dropped to $8 to $10 a share from $12 to $14, according to a source close to the underwriters.

In July, the deal was postponed amid a broad decline in high-technology and Internet stocks. Many investment professionals have said the deal was overpriced, even after reducing levels this time around.
